A collection of things I've found useful for research, teaching, and navigating academia. I'll update this periodically as I find new resources.

```{=html}
<div class="resource-sections">

<div class="resource-card">
  <h2><i class="fa-solid fa-people-arrows"></i> Mentoring & Professional Development</h2>
  <p>As a first-generation college student, I know how hard it can be to navigate into and around academia without existing connections. I try to volunteer my time as a mentor whenever possible, and I'd encourage anyone in a similar position to reach out.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><strong><a href="https://phd-workshop.classes.ianmccarthyecon.com/">PhD Professionalism Workshop</a></strong>. A workshop I run for 2nd-5th year Economics PhD students covering best practices for workflow, conferences, presentations, and the job market.</li>
    <li><a href="https://ashecon.org/">ASHEcon</a> annual mentorship sessions, 2018-2025</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.researchincolor.org/">Research in Color</a>, 2019-2021</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.amentecon.org/">Association for Mentoring and Inclusion in Economics</a>, 2022-2024</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h2><i class="fa-brands fa-github"></i> GitHub Repositories</h2>
  <p>Public code and data that others might find useful.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><strong><a href="https://github.com/imccart/Medicare-Advantage">Medicare Advantage</a></strong>. Code to organize and clean the CMS Medicare Advantage enrollment and plan data.</li>
    <li><strong><a href="https://github.com/imccart/HCRIS">HCRIS</a></strong>. Code to organize and clean the CMS Healthcare Cost Report Information System data.</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h2><i class="fa-solid fa-database"></i> Data Sources</h2>
  <p>Publicly available data useful for health economics and applied micro research.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="https://datasetsearch.research.google.com/">Google Dataset Search</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.icpsr.umich.edu/web/pages/">ICPSR</a> (Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research)</li>
    <li><a href="https://fred.stlouisfed.org/">FRED</a> (Federal Reserve Economic Data)</li>
    <li><a href="https://data.nber.org/">NBER Public Use Data</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.ipums.org/">IPUMS</a> (census, CPS, ACS, and more)</li>
    <li><a href="https://wonder.cdc.gov/">CDC WONDER</a> (mortality, natality, environmental data)</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.bea.gov/data">Bureau of Economic Analysis</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.data-is-plural.com/">Data is Plural</a> (curated newsletter of interesting datasets)</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h2><i class="fa-solid fa-graduation-cap"></i> Learning & Methods</h2>
  <p>Free textbooks, lecture series, and other resources for learning econometrics and causal inference.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="https://mixtape.scunning.com/">Causal Inference: The Mixtape</a> (Scott Cunningham)</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/miguel-hernan/causal-inference-book/">Causal Inference: What If</a> (Hernan & Robins)</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.ssc.wisc.edu/~bhansen/econometrics/">Econometrics</a> (Bruce Hansen)</li>
    <li><a href="https://theeffectbook.net/">The Effect</a> (Nick Huntington-Klein)</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.nber.org/lectures">NBER Lecture Series</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.aeaweb.org/about-aea/committees/continuing-education">AEA Continuing Education</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://lost-stats.github.io/">LOST</a> (Library of Statistical Techniques)</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h2><i class="fa-solid fa-pen-fancy"></i> Writing & Presenting</h2>
  <p>Advice on writing and presenting academic work.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/Research/Shapiro/pdfs/w_intro.pdf">How to Give an Applied Micro Talk</a> (Jesse Shapiro)</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/Research/Shapiro/pdfs/foursteps.pdf">Four Steps to an Applied Micro Paper</a> (Jesse Shapiro)</li>
    <li><a href="https://marcfbellemare.com/wordpress/12797">The Introduction Formula</a> (Keith Head, via Marc Bellemare)</li>
    <li><a href="https://marcfbellemare.com/wordpress/12060">Between the Introduction and the Conclusion</a> (Marc Bellemare)</li>
    <li><a href="https://rachmeager.com/assets/pdfs/public_speaking_for_academic_economists.pdf">Public Speaking for Academic Economists</a> (Rachael Meager)</li>
    <li><a href="https://github.com/paulgp/beamer-tips">Beamer Tips</a> (Paul Goldsmith-Pinkham)</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h2><i class="fa-solid fa-cube"></i> Useful R Packages</h2>
  <p>Packages I use regularly for applied econometrics and data visualization.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="https://lrberge.github.io/fixest/">fixest</a> — Fast fixed-effects estimation (OLS, IV, Poisson, negative binomial)</li>
    <li><a href="https://modelsummary.com/">modelsummary</a> — Publication-quality regression tables and data summaries</li>
    <li><a href="https://github.com/evanjflack/bacondecomp">bacondecomp</a> — Goodman-Bacon decomposition for staggered diff-in-diff</li>
    <li><a href="https://yiqingxu.org/packages/panelView/">panelView</a> — Visualize panel data and treatment timing</li>
    <li><a href="https://github.com/carloscinelli/sensemakr">sensemakr</a> — Sensitivity analysis for omitted variable bias</li>
    <li><a href="https://kylebutts.github.io/did2s/">did2s</a> — Two-stage diff-in-diff estimation (Gardner 2022)</li>
    <li><a href="https://github.com/joachim-gassen/rdfanalysis">rdfanalysis</a> — Researcher degrees of freedom / specification curves</li>
  </ul>
</div>

</div>
```
